sentences.sContent: Mr English, an associate editor of the Guardian, is a polymath who wears his learning lightly.
sentences.sContent_eng: Mr English, an associate editor of the Guardian, is a polymath who wears his learning lightly.
sentences.sCn: 英格力士先生是《卫报》的副编辑，是一位略显才华的博学者。

sentences.sContent: Shen Kuo (1031~1095) was a Chinese scientist, polymath, general, diplomat, and financial officer who was the inventor of compasses for navigation.
sentences.sContent_eng: Shen Kuo (1031~1095) was a Chinese scientist, polymath, general, diplomat, and financial officer who was the inventor of compasses for navigation.
sentences.sCn: 沈括（1031~1095 ），科学家、博学者、将军、外交家、财务官员，发明了指南针。

sentences.sContent: Explorer, , polymath, friend of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Thomas Jefferson and Simon Bolívar, Alexander von Humboldt was one of the greatest scientists of the 19th century.
sentences.sContent_eng: Explorer, , polymath, friend of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Thomas Jefferson and Simon Bolívar, Alexander von Humboldt was one of the greatest scientists of the 19th century.
sentences.sCn: 探险家，博学者，歌德、杰弗逊和玻利瓦尔的朋友，洪堡是十九世纪最伟大的科学家之一，他的想法至今都没有过时。

remMethod.val: poly(多) + math(学习) → 学得多 → 博学者

trans.tranOther: someone who has a lot of knowledge about many different subjects
